intro: Cnestis platantha, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong fragrance. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The flowers open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
